recipe.name: Pork in Lime Cream Sauce
recipe.notes: I have already decided that I will, in future editions, list this as "Lime Cream Sauce (With Pork)".  The sauce itself is the thing here, whatever meat you put it upon is merely a window-dressing.  If one cannot reasonably come across pork tenderloin, I'm sure pork chops, chicken and lightly-flavored fish would do nicely smothered in this sauce as well.Rated "Fantastic!" by my mother.
recipe.preparation: Over high heat in an oven-proof skillet heat oil.  Brown pork on all sides and transfer pan to 400F oven.  Roast until cooked through -- about 20 minutes.Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat and add onions and shallots.  Saute for 3 minutes and add wine and boil until liquid is reduced by half -- about five minutes.  Add chicken broth and beef broth and boil until reduced to 6 tbsp -- over 20 minutes.  Add cream and reduce at a boil to 1 cup, about 7 minutes.  Season with salt and pepper.Slice meat and plate, smothering with sauce.
recipe.source_name: "Almanor Westshore Cooks", contributed by Yvonne Kerr
